title: Scott Hahn Genesis Bible Study: The Covenant As a Family Affair
description:
Dr. Scott Hahn - Genesis 1-22: The Covenant As a Family Affair (7-disc Bible study + PDF course guide)

Genesis 1-22: The Covenant as a Family Affair
A University Level Course in Sacred Scripture
A Scott Hahn Bible Study Developed by Dr. Carol Younger

Copied from 7-disc CD Series with scanned 56-page group study guide (PDF)
Total run time: 06:27:23

What really went on in the Garden of Eden? Adam and Eve. Cain and Abel. Noah and the Ark. While most people are familiar with the colorful tales in the first book of Scripture, how many truly understand their profound significance to human destiny? Can what you donÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know about the Book of Genesis keep you from fully grasping the Ã¢â‚¬Å“whole storyÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½ of Sacred Scripture? At last! Discover the interpretive principles that will empower you to understand all the other books of both the Old and New Testaments! In this insightful Bible study, renowned theologian and Biblical scholar Dr. Scott Hahn expertly guides you through the first twenty-two chapters of Genesis to reveal the key interpretive principles that lie hidden there. As he carefully explains these indispensable treasures of understanding, you'll discover the clear-cut pattern for God's plan of salvation. For the first time you'll clearly see the essential recurring themes that connect the many persons, events and literary genres of both the Old and New Testaments. Nowhere else will you find material of this depth in such an easy-to-follow format! If you've ever been confused or frustrated in your study of the Bible, this inspiring and enlightening study will enable you to finally see "the whole story" by taking you back to where it all began.

According to Dr. Hahn, Ã¢â‚¬Å“If you understand what is written in Genesis, you will have a firmer grasp of the Christian message than many contemporary theologians!Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½ The life of Jesus Christ will come alive for you! With this series plus the Study Guide, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll follow verse-by-verse commentary, explanations of key Greek and Hebrew words, background information on how key passages are used in both Catholic and Protestant theology, plus explanations of how various words and phrases are commonly misinterpreted, as well as suggestions for further reading. But thatÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s not all! YouÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll also discover a wealth of relevant personal insights as Dr. Hahn reveals that God sees us not only as we are, but also as we have been, and as we always will be. As Dr. Hahn carefully explains the indispensable treasures of wisdom hidden in the biblical narrative, youÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ll discern the clear-cut pattern for GodÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s perfect plan of salvation. In fact Dr. Hahn reveals how all of the covenant relationships in Genesis point to their ultimate fulfillment in Jesus Christ and His Church.

This insightful Scripture Study is now available with a comprehensive 56-page Listening and Group Study Guide prepared by Dr. Carol Younger, Ed.D. to make mastering the material easier than ever! The included scanned workbook is intended to help the listener follow Dr. Hahn's presentation of the Bible Study Course, Genesis 1-22: The Covenant as a Family Affair, by allowing you to fill in information in appropriate places and to take notes on the important aspects of each CD in the series. Following the listening guide, there is a review of each section of Genesis together with discussion questions. This section is intended for either a Sacred Scripture study group of friends or for further individual reflection on Genesis, its meanings and application in our daily lives. Don't wait, organize a Sacred Scripture study group with your friends and family today! The workbook features an easy fill-in-the-blank and note-taking format to capture key points without getting left behind while you are listening to Dr. Hahn which should benefit your learning and your encounter with Jesus Christ. Simply (a) fill in the blanks or (b) circle the correct answer as you listen. References to the Bible are cited on the page so that you may pause the CD and find the specific passages. The workbook also includes additional questions at the end of the section for each CD to better assist in your understanding of the listening and the notes/answers you have just completed. This helps you to integrate what has been learned with other parts of the Bible and to apply insights gained to your own spiritual life.

LEARN:

Why Genesis is the most controversial Old Testament book for modern religion
What God was doing before He created
Why the literal and spiritual meanings of Scripture are not in opposition
Where the first promise of the Gospel is revealed in Genesis
Why the Church is called the Ã¢â‚¬Å“New EveÃ¢â‚¬ï¿½
How the stories of Jonah and Babel have special significance to the Church
Why many of the characters in Genesis lived such extraordinarily long lives
How family origins or family name promote spiritual strength
Why Christ is called a priest according to the order of Melchizedek
How everything in the Catholic Church is a fulfillment of Old Testament covenants
And much more...
